questions.question: Evaluate the definite integral \(\int_0^2 (2x+1)^4\,dx\).
Evaluate \(\int_0^{\pi/2}\sin x\cos^3 x\,dx\).
Evaluate \(\int_2^{2e^3}\dfrac{1}{x}\,dx\).
A particle moves along the x‑axis with velocity \(v(t)=-t^2+6t-5\) m/s. On the interval \([0,7]\), how many times does the particle change direction?
questions.explanation: Set \(v(t)=0\): \(-(t-1)(t-5)=0\) ⇒ \(t=1\) and \(t=5\). Check signs: \(v(0)=-5<0\), \(v(3)=-9+18-5=4>0\), \(v(6)=-36+36-5=-5<0\). The velocity changes sign at both \(t=1\) and \(t=5\), so the particle changes direction 2 times.

questions.question: Find the average value of \(f(x)=\dfrac{1}{x}\) on the interval \([1,e]\).
Let \(f(x)=2x^3-x-6\). Which of the following correctly applies the Intermediate Value Theorem to guarantee a zero on the given interval?
questions.explanation: IVT requires a sign change. \(f(1)=2-1-6=-5<0\) and \(f(2)=16-2-6=8>0\). Since \(f\) is continuous and changes sign on \([1,2]\), there is a zero there. All other options show the same sign at both endpoints.

questions.question: Find the general solution to the differential equation \(\dfrac{dy}{dx}=\dfrac{e^x}{y^2}\).
Let \(G(x)=\int_x^{x^2} t^3\,dt\). Find \(G'(x)\).
questions.explanation: By FTC Part 1 with variable limits in both bounds: \(G'(x)=(x^2)^3\cdot\frac{d}{dx}(x^2)-x^3\cdot\frac{d}{dx}(x)=x^6\cdot2x-x^3\cdot1=2x^7-x^3\).

questions.question: Differentiate \(f(x)=e^{x^3-2x}\).
Find \(f'(x)\) if \(f(x)=\cos(\sqrt{x})\).
Let \(f(x)=\begin{cases}\dfrac{x^2-4}{x-2} & x\ne2\\k & x=2\end{cases}\). What value of \(k\) makes \(f\) continuous at \(x=2\)?
questions.explanation: For \(x\ne2\): \(\frac{x^2-4}{x-2}=\frac{(x+2)(x-2)}{x-2}=x+2\). As \(x\to2\), this limit equals \(2+2=4\). For continuity, \(k=f(2)=4\).

questions.question: Find all x‑values where \(f(x)=x^5-5x^4\) has a point of inflection.
questions.explanation: \(f'(x)=5x^4-20x^3\), \(f''(x)=20x^3-60x^2=20x^2(x-3)\). Setting \(f''=0\) gives \(x=0\) and \(x=3\). At \(x=0\): \(f''\) is negative on both sides (no sign change), so \(x=0\) is NOT an inflection point. At \(x=3\): \(f''\) changes from negative (for \(x<3\)) to positive (for \(x>3\)), so \(x=3\) is the only inflection point.

questions.question: Use implicit differentiation to find \(\dfrac{dy}{dx}\) for \(e^y+xy=5\).
questions.explanation: Differentiate both sides with respect to \(x\): \(e^y y'+y+xy'=0\). Collect \(y'\): \(y'(e^y+x)=-y\), so \(y'=-\frac{y}{e^y+x}\).

questions.question: Find the equation of the normal line to \(y=\tan x\) at the point \((0,0)\).
questions.explanation: \(y'=\sec^2 x\). At \(x=0\): tangent slope \(=\sec^2(0)=1\). Normal slope \(=-1\). Equation: \(y-0=-1(x-0)\), so \(y=-x\).

questions.question: Let \(f(x)=x^2\ln x\). Find the instantaneous rate of change of \(f\) at \(x=e\).
questions.explanation: Product rule: \(f'(x)=2x\ln x+x^2\cdot\frac{1}{x}=2x\ln x+x=x(2\ln x+1)\). At \(x=e\): \(f'(e)=e(2\ln e+1)=e(2+1)=3e\).

questions.question: If \(q(-1)=7\) and \(q(4)=-3\), find \(\int_{-1}^{4}q'(x)\,dx\).
questions.explanation: By the Fundamental Theorem of Calculus: \(\int_{-1}^4 q'(x)\,dx=q(4)-q(-1)=-3-7=-10\).

questions.question: For \(f(x)=\sqrt{x}\) on \([1,9]\), find the value of \(c\) in \((1,9)\) guaranteed by the Mean Value Theorem.
Differentiate \(f(x)=\dfrac{x^2+3x}{x-1}\).
A particle has velocity \(v(t)=t^3-3t^2-9t+2\) ft/s on \([0,6]\). Find the minimum value of the velocity on this interval.
Determine the interval(s) on which \(f(x)=x^2e^{-x}\) is increasing.
Consider \(f(x)=\begin{cases}x^2 & x\le1\\3x-2 & x>1\end{cases}\). Is \(f\) differentiable at \(x=1\)?
options: No; \(f\) is continuous at \(x=1\) but the left derivative is 2 and the right derivative is 3
Yes; both pieces give the same value at \(x=1\)
Yes; the derivatives of both pieces agree at \(x=1\)
questions.explanation: At \(x=1\): left value \(=1^2=1\), right value \(=3(1)-2=1\). So \(f\) is continuous. Left derivative: \(\frac{d}{dx}x^2\big|_{x=1}=2\). Right derivative: \(\frac{d}{dx}(3x-2)\big|_{x=1}=3\). Since \(2\ne3\), \(f\) is not differentiable at \(x=1\).

questions.question: Bacteria in a culture grow at a rate of \(r(t)=200e^{0.5t}\) cells per hour. How many cells are added from \(t=0\) to \(t=2\) hours?

The derivative \(f'(x)\) changes from negative to positive at \(x=-4\), from positive to negative at \(x=2\), and equals zero at \(x=6\) with \(f'\) positive on both sides of \(x=6\). Classify each critical point.
options: Min at \(-4\), max at \(2\), neither at \(6\)
Max at \(-4\), min at \(2\), neither at \(6\)
Min at \(-4\), max at \(2\), min at \(6\)
Max at \(-4\), min at \(2\), max at \(6\)
questions.explanation: First Derivative Test: − to + ⇒ relative minimum at \(x=-4\); + to − ⇒ relative maximum at \(x=2\); positive on both sides ⇒ no sign change at \(x=6\), so neither.

questions.question: Find the area under the curve \(y=\dfrac{3}{x}\) from \(x=1\) to \(x=3\).
At \(x=a\), a function satisfies \(f(a)<0\), \(f'(a)>0\), and \(f''(a)>0\). Which description best matches the behavior near \(x=a\)?
questions.explanation: \(f(a)<0\) means below the x‑axis; \(f'(a)>0\) means increasing; \(f''(a)>0\) means concave up.

questions.question: Evaluate \(\int_1^4\dfrac{3}{\sqrt{x}}\,dx\).
Find the area of the region enclosed by \(y=x^3\) and \(y=x\) on \([-1,1]\).
questions.explanation: Intersections at \(x=-1,0,1\). On \((0,1)\): \(x>x^3\). On \((-1,0)\): \(x^3>x\). By odd-function symmetry both pieces are equal. Area \(=2\int_0^1(x-x^3)\,dx=2\left[\frac{x^2}{2}-\frac{x^4}{4}\right]_0^1=2\!\left(\frac{1}{2}-\frac{1}{4}\right)=2\cdot\frac{1}{4}=\frac{1}{2}\).

questions.question: For \(f(x)=x^3-3x^2+1\), determine the interval(s) on which \(f\) is concave down.
Find the equation of the tangent line to \(f(x)=e^{2x}\) at \(x=0\).

Water drains from a conical tank (with the apex at the bottom). The tank has radius‑to‑height ratio \(r=h/2\). When the water depth is 4 m, the volume is decreasing at 2 m³/min. How fast is the depth decreasing at that moment?
questions.explanation: With \(r=h/2\): \(V=\frac{1}{3}\pi r^2 h=\frac{1}{3}\pi\frac{h^2}{4}\cdot h=\frac{\pi h^3}{12}\). Differentiate: \(\frac{dV}{dt}=\frac{\pi h^2}{4}\frac{dh}{dt}\). At \(h=4\) and \(\frac{dV}{dt}=-2\): \(-2=\frac{\pi(16)}{4}\frac{dh}{dt}=4\pi\frac{dh}{dt}\) ⇒ \(\frac{dh}{dt}=-\frac{1}{2\pi}\) m/min. The depth decreases at \(\frac{1}{2\pi}\) m/min.

questions.question: A population doubles every 3 years. If the initial population is 100, what is the population after 6 years?
Find all relative extrema of \(f(x)=x^4-4x^2+1\) using the First Derivative Test.
options: Relative minima at \(x=\pm\sqrt{2}\); relative maximum at \(x=0\)
Relative maxima at \(x=\pm\sqrt{2}\); relative minimum at \(x=0\)
questions.explanation: \(f'(x)=4x^3-8x=4x(x^2-2)=4x(x-\sqrt{2})(x+\sqrt{2})\). Critical: \(x=0,\pm\sqrt{2}\). Sign of \(f'\): negative for \(x<-\sqrt{2}\), positive for \(-\sqrt{2}<x<0\), negative for \(0<x<\sqrt{2}\), positive for \(x>\sqrt{2}\). So: relative min at \(x=-\sqrt{2}\) and \(x=\sqrt{2}\); relative max at \(x=0\).

questions.question: Let \(f(x)=\begin{cases}\dfrac{\sin x}{x} & x\ne0\\k & x=0\end{cases}\). What value of \(k\) makes \(f\) continuous at \(x=0\)?
questions.explanation: The well-known limit \(\lim_{x\to0}\frac{\sin x}{x}=1\). For continuity at \(x=0\), \(k=f(0)=1\).

questions.question: Use the Trapezoidal Rule with \(n=4\) equal subintervals to approximate \(\int_0^{\pi}\sin x\,dx\).
Find the only critical point of \(f(x)=\cos(2x)+2x\) on \([0,\pi]\).
questions.explanation: \(f'(x)=-2\sin(2x)+2=0\) ⇒ \(\sin(2x)=1\) ⇒ \(2x=\frac{\pi}{2}\) ⇒ \(x=\frac{\pi}{4}\). The next solution would be \(2x=\frac{5\pi}{2}\) ⇒ \(x=\frac{5\pi}{4}>\pi\), which is outside \([0,\pi]\). So the only critical point is \(x=\frac{\pi}{4}\).

questions.question: The base of a solid is the region bounded by \(y=4-x^2\) and \(y=0\). Cross sections perpendicular to the x‑axis are semicircles with diameters along the base. Find the volume.
questions.explanation: The base extends from \(x=-2\) to \(x=2\). Diameter of each semicircle \(=4-x^2\), so radius \(=\frac{4-x^2}{2}\). Semicircle area \(=\frac{\pi}{2}r^2=\frac{\pi(4-x^2)^2}{8}\). Volume \(=\int_{-2}^2\frac{\pi(4-x^2)^2}{8}\,dx=\frac{\pi}{4}\int_0^2(4-x^2)^2\,dx\). Expand: \(\int_0^2(16-8x^2+x^4)\,dx=\left[16x-\frac{8x^3}{3}+\frac{x^5}{5}\right]_0^2=32-\frac{64}{3}+\frac{32}{5}=\frac{256}{15}\). Volume \(=\frac{\pi}{4}\cdot\frac{256}{15}=\frac{64\pi}{15}\).

questions.question: At what point on \(y=x^2-3x\) is the tangent line parallel to \(y=5x-1\)?
questions.explanation: Slope of given line \(=5\). Set \(y'=2x-3=5\) ⇒ \(x=4\). Then \(y=16-12=4\). The point is \((4,4)\).

questions.question: Is \(f(x)=|x^2-2x|\) differentiable at \(x=0\)? Justify.
options: No; the left derivative is \(-2\) and the right derivative is \(2\)
Yes; the function is continuous at \(x=0\)
No; the function is not continuous at \(x=0\)
questions.explanation: Near \(x=0\): for \(x<0\), \(x(x-2)>0\) so \(f=x^2-2x\); for \(0<x<2\), \(x(x-2)<0\) so \(f=2x-x^2\). Left derivative at \(x=0\): \(\frac{d}{dx}(x^2-2x)\big|_0=2(0)-2=-2\). Right derivative: \(\frac{d}{dx}(2x-x^2)\big|_0=2-0=2\). Since \(-2\ne2\), \(f\) is not differentiable at \(x=0\).

questions.question: Let \(K(x)=\int_0^{\ln x}e^t\,dt\). Find \(K'(x)\).
questions.explanation: By FTC and the chain rule: \(K'(x)=e^{\ln x}\cdot\frac{d}{dx}(\ln x)=x\cdot\frac{1}{x}=1\). Alternatively, \(K(x)=e^t\Big|_0^{\ln x}=e^{\ln x}-1=x-1\), so \(K'(x)=1\).

questions.question: Evaluate \(\displaystyle\lim_{x\to0}\frac{1-\cos(2x)}{x^2}\).
questions.explanation: Form \(\frac{0}{0}\). Apply L'Hôpital: \(\lim\frac{2\sin(2x)}{2x}\). Still \(\frac{0}{0}\). Apply again: \(\lim\frac{4\cos(2x)}{2}=\frac{4}{2}=2\).

questions.question: Two positive numbers \(x\) and \(y\) satisfy \(x+2y=20\). Find the values of \(x\) and \(y\) that maximize \(P=xy^2\), and state the maximum value.
Use the Second Derivative Test to classify the critical point of \(f(x)=x\ln x\) (for \(x>0\)).
Use a right Riemann sum with \(n=4\) equal subintervals to approximate \(\int_0^4(x^2-x+1)\,dx\).
Find \(\dfrac{d}{dx}\left[\arctan(\sqrt{x})\right]\).
A particle has position \(s(t)=t^4-4t^3+4t^2+2\). Find the acceleration at each moment when the velocity is zero.
Find the absolute maximum and minimum values of \(f(x)=2x^3-3x^2-12x+5\) on \([-2,3]\).
options: Absolute max \(12\) at \(x=-1\); absolute min \(-15\) at \(x=2\)
Absolute max \(5\) at \(x=0\); absolute min \(-15\) at \(x=2\)
Absolute max \(12\) at \(x=-1\); absolute min \(-4\) at \(x=3\)
Absolute max \(1\) at \(x=-2\); absolute min \(-15\) at \(x=2\)

questions.question: Solve the initial value problem \(\dfrac{dy}{dx}=y\cos x\), \(y(0)=2\).
questions.explanation: Separate: \(\frac{dy}{y}=\cos x\,dx\) ⇒ \(\ln|y|=\sin x+C\) ⇒ \(y=Ae^{\sin x}\). Apply \(y(0)=2\): \(A e^{\sin 0}=A=2\). So \(y=2e^{\sin x}\).

questions.question: A particle moves with velocity \(v(t)=4-t^2\) ft/s on \([0,3]\). Find both the displacement and the total distance traveled.
Differentiate \(f(x)=\sqrt{3x^2+1}\).
Use linear approximation at \(x=0\) to estimate \(\sqrt{1.04}\).
